definition: (literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Don't take it to heart. They are just babes and sucklings.
sentences.chinese: 不要放在心上，那些只是些乳臭未乾的小子。

sentences.english: A naughty monkey is yellow, yellow teeth.
sentences.chinese: 小猴更調皮，叫小黃“黃牙小子”。

sentences.english: Rose is simply the new kid on the block, they argue.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯只不過是一個乳臭未乾的小子，他們說。

sentences.english: The poor boy was named during a streetcar strike in New Orleans in 1929.
sentences.chinese: 窮小子在1929年新奧爾良公車罷工期間得名。

sentences.english: God knows when that speechless children of ours namely working to graduate from high educate.
sentences.chinese: 天知道我們那個傻小子什麼時候能中壆畢業。

sentences.english: I've already schooled you once tonight, homeboy.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我已經教訓過你一次了，臭小子。

sentences.english: That's the interfering chap I ever see.
sentences.chinese: 我還沒見過那麼愛管閒事的小子。

sentences.english: No one knows when will our silly boy graduate from middle school.
sentences.chinese: 天知道我們那個傻小子什麼時候能中學畢業。
那小子就是我的斯諾登。

sentences.english: You ever served in an infantry unit, son?
sentences.chinese: 你曾在步兵團服過役嗎，小子？

sentences.english: I stepped in front of the kid and slapped him hard across the face.
sentences.chinese: 我走上前去，狠狠扇了胖小子一耳光。

sentences.english: No problem. No task is too small for the Waterboy.
sentences.chinese: 沒問題，對茶水小子來說沒有什麼是小事。

sentences.english: O. K. didn't humiliate this, otherwise, I will likewise dead to have no whole corpseses.
sentences.chinese: 還好沒有欺負到這小子頭上，不然，我也會死無全屍。

sentences.english: I'm gonna get my back from that old bird.
sentences.chinese: 我得從從老小子那兒把槍要回來。

sentences.english: Follow that guy and see where he goes.
sentences.chinese: 跟着那小子，看看他去哪。

sentences.english: Your mercedes wasn't enough, you brats.
sentences.chinese: 你們有了的奔馳不夠，你們這羣臭小子。

definition: (coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon
(affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy/old pal
little demon (term of endearment for a child)/mischievous child/imp
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
